description:
This module examines the major themes in the study of history and memory. It addresses questions about the importance of investigating memory, its construction, its production, and its impact on personal and group identities, popular understandings of the past, and national identity. Topics explored include the relationship and tension between historical research and memory; individual and collective memories; the politics of memory; and memorial practices. The class
will also examine the memory industry and the business of memorialization.
title: History and Memory
